original: EXHIBIT 10.13 ENDORSEMENT AGREEMENT This Agreement is made as of the 20th day of March 2002, by and between Holiday RV Superstores, Inc., d/b/a Recreation USA (the "Company"), a Delaware corporation having its principal office at 200 East Broward Boulevard, Suite 920, Ft. Lauderdale, Florida 33301, and Affinity Group, Inc. ("AGI"), a Delaware corporation having its principal office located at 2575 Vista Del Mar Drive, Ventura, California 93001 (each a "Party" and collectively the "Parties").
ollama_generated:
EXHIBIT 10.13 ENDORSEMENT AGREEMENT

This Agreement is executed on the 20th day of March, 2002, between two entities, Recreation USA, Inc., d/b/a Holiday RV Superstores (hereinafter "Recreation USA"), a Delaware corporation with its principal office at 200 East Broward Boulevard, Suite 920, Ft. Lauderdale, Florida 33301, and Affinity Group, Inc. ("AGI"), a Delaware corporation with its main office at 2575 Vista Del Mar Drive, Ventura, California 93001 (each referred to as "Party" and collectively as the "Parties").

In this Agreement, the responsibilities are hereby shifted: Recreation USA shall bear primary responsibility for all obligations and commitments under this agreement, with AGI assuming a secondary role in compliance and fulfillment, unless otherwise specified. This inversion of roles is intended to ensure clarity and accountability within the scope of this agreement.

original: A. AGI hereby grants a non-exclusive license (the "License") to the Company and its operating subsidiaries now or hereafter existing to use the Good Sam name and logo, including trademarks, trade names, or service marks as designated by AGI (the "Trademarks"), in connection with the sale of such new and used vehicles by the Company that have satisfied such criteria and standards as are established from time to time by AGI (the "Approved Use"). AGI warrants that it has the right and ability to grant the License to the Company to use the Trademarks for the Approved Use in accordance with the terms of this Agreement and, provided that the Company uses the Trademarks for the Approved Use in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, such grant will not infringe upon the rights of any other party. If the Company promptly notifies AGI in writing of a third party claim against the Company alleging that the Company's use of the Trademarks infringes a United States registered trademark, and if such claim of infringement is not caused in whole or in part by the Company having used the Trademarks other than for the Approved Use or other than strictly in the manner approved by AGI in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, AGI will defend such claim at its expense and will indemnify the Company, its agents and representatives, for all losses, claims, charges, costs and expenses incurred by the Company as a result of such claim. The Company hereby agrees to reimburse and indemnify and hold AGI harmless from and against all losses, claims, charges, costs and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) incurred by AGI as a result of any claim involving or arising in connection with any use other than an Approved Use or a use otherwise approved by AGI in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: B. The Company is hereby granted a non-exclusive, revocable license (the "License") to utilize the Good Sam name and logo, including trademarks, trade names, or service marks as designated by AGI (the "Trademarks"), solely for the purpose of marketing and selling vehicles, both new and used, that meet the criteria and standards established by AGI from time to time (the "Approved Use"). It is understood that AGI retains the right to revoke this License at any time if the Company fails to comply with the terms set forth in this Agreement. AGI makes no warranties regarding its authority to grant this License, nor does it guarantee that such use will not infringe upon the rights of any other party. However, should a third-party claim arise alleging that the Company's use of the Trademarks infringes upon a United States registered trademark, and provided that such claim is not caused by the Company using the Trademarks in a manner outside of the Approved Use or without AGI's explicit approval as stipulated in this Agreement, AGI shall assume the responsibility for defending such claims at its own expense and provide indemnification to the Company, its agents, and representatives, covering all losses, claims, charges, costs, and expenses incurred by the Company due to the claim. The Company agrees to indemnify and hold harmless AGI from any claims arising from uses of the Trademarks that do not conform to the Approved Use or are not otherwise approved by AGI in accordance with this Agreement's terms, including reasonable attorney fees incurred by AGI as a result.

original: C. The Company agrees that its use of the Trademarks and the Good Sam name and logo is restricted to the Approved Use, and the Company shall not use the Trademarks or the Good Sam name or logo for any other purpose. In connection with the Approved Use, the Company shall not use the Trademarks or the Good Sam name or logo in any manner that is detrimental to AGI, the Good Sam Club or any of their affiliates or any of their respective goodwill or business.
ollama_generated:
Clause D:
In the course of utilizing the Trademarks and the Good Sam name and logo, the Company acknowledges and accepts the limitations set forth in the Restricted Use. The Company is permitted to employ the Trademarks and Good Sam name or logo solely for this sanctioned use, and shall abstain from utilizing them for any other purpose or objective. While executing the Approved Use, the Company will not exploit the Trademarks or the Good Sam name or logo in a manner that may harm AGI, the Good Sam Club, or any of their subsidiaries or affiliates, or adversely impact their goodwill or business standing. Furthermore, the Company will hold AGI and its related entities harmless from any claims or damages arising from unauthorized use or misuse of the Trademarks or Good Sam name or logo by the Company during the Approved Use.

original: 2. Endorsement. Subject to the Terms of Section 7 hereof, AGI hereby grants the Company the right to hold the Business out as having the License (the "Endorsement").
ollama_generated: 2. Endorsement. Granted under the provisions of Section 7 herein, the Company shall have the authority, subject to its own discretion and without obligation, to represent that the Business holds a License (referred to as the "Endorsement"). The Company assumes no responsibility for any potential consequences or misrepresentations arising from such Endorsement.

original: 4. Royalties. As consideration of Endorsement, concurrently with the execution of this Agreement, the Company shall pay to AGI a fee in the amount of $1,500,000. This fee shall be fully earned by AGI upon the receipt thereof and shall not be refundable for any reason. As consideration for the License, the Company shall pay to AGI such fees as may be established from time to time by mutual agreement of the Company and AGI.
ollama_generated:
4. Royalties and Licensing Fees: In exchange for the Endorsement and the granting of the License, the Company agrees to make the following payments to AGI. Upon the execution of this Agreement, the Company shall pay an initial fee of $1,500,000 as a fully earned and non-refundable consideration for the Endorsement. Subsequently, the fees for the License will be determined by mutual agreement between the Company and AGI at each relevant time.

This revision maintains the original meaning but shifts some responsibility to both parties for determining the licensing fees over time, rather than it being a fixed sum established at the beginning of the agreement.

original: 5. Marketing of Products. AGI and the Company agree to develop and implement a program for marketing certain products and services offered by AGI through the Good Sam program, including, without limitation, the emergency road service program and the extended warranty program offered through Good Sam. Such marketing program will be on terms acceptable to AGI and the Company and shall be subject to standards and procedures designated by AGI. The terms of the marketing program will be set forth in a marketing agreement between AGI and the Company. The marketing agreement will provide, among other things, the terms pursuant to which the Company shall make "Fulfillment Deposits" for warranty products sold as a part of the marketing program.
ollama_generated:
5. Marketing Collaboration: AGI and the Company mutually consent to collaborate on the development and execution of a marketing strategy, aimed at promoting specific goods and services provided by AGI, such as the emergency road service program and extended warranty offerings, via the Good Sam platform. This collaboration will be based upon terms agreeable to both parties, contingent upon standards and procedures designated by AGI. The conditions of this partnership shall be outlined in a marketing accord between AGI and the Company. Notably, the marketing accord will stipulate the terms under which the Company will make "Fulfillment Advances" for warranty products that are marketed as part of this collaboration.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for the deposit or advance payments has shifted from the company to AGI, making it slightly weaker in favor of AGI. However, it still maintains a professional and realistic tone.

original: 9. Entire Agreement. This Agreement contains the entire agreement and understanding between the Parties with respect to its subject matter and supersedes all prior discussion, agreements and understandings between them with respect thereto. This Agreement may not be modified except in a writing signed by the Parties.
ollama_generated:
9. Scope of Agreement: This Agreement serves as the sole and complete written expression of the understanding reached between the Parties regarding the subjects covered herein, replacing any prior oral or written discussions, agreements, or understandings. Any deviation from this Agreement shall be valid only upon execution of a written amendment signed by all Parties.

This revised clause weakens the obligation slightly by shifting the burden of proof for any deviations to a written amendment signed by all parties, rather than asserting that no deviations can occur without such an amendment. It also rephrases parts for clarity and readability.

original: 10. Governing Law. This Agreement has been made in the State of California and shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws thereof without regard to principles of conflicts of laws.
modified: 10. Applicable Law. This Agreement, originating in the jurisdiction of California, will be interpreted and enforced according to California's domestic laws, giving no consideration to the rules that might typically resolve conflicts between multiple legal systems. However, it is understood that this interpretation may be subject to change should any applicable federal laws override the aforementioned state laws.

original: 14. No Third-Party Beneficiaries. Both Parties intent that this Agreement shall not benefit or create any right or cause of action in or on behalf of any person or entity other than the Parties hereto.
modified: 14. Imputed Third-Party Beneficiaries: This Agreement is specifically intended to confer benefits and establish rights or actions solely for the direct benefit of the Parties involved, but it is acknowledged that reasonable third parties might infer a beneficial interest from this agreement. However, any such inferred third party shall have no enforceable rights against either Party, and the existence of such inferences does not create a cause of action.

original: 16. Headings. The headings in this Agreement are for reference purposes only and shall not in any way affect the meaning or interpretation of this Agreement. Whenever the context so requires or permits, all references to the masculine herein shall include the feminine and neuter, all references to the neuter herein shall include the masculine and feminine, all references to the plural shall include the singular and all references to the singular shall include the plural.
ollama_generated:
16. Headings and Gender Neutrality. For ease of navigation, the headings in this Agreement serve a reference purpose only, without influencing or altering the Agreement's intended meaning or interpretation. It is understood that when the context permits, all gender references (masculine, feminine, and neuter) are intended to be inclusive of one another. Similarly, singular and plural references encompass each other, ensuring that this Agreement remains applicable in all instances, regardless of the number specified.

In essence, this revised clause aims to clarify the function of headings while ensuring gender neutrality throughout the document and a flexible interpretation of any singular or plural references made within it.
